error.signature: Readiness probe failed: endpoint not ready, no endpoints available for service
error.regex: endpoint.*not ready|no endpoints available|Endpoints.*NotReadyAddresses|service has no endpoints

verdict.summary: Service endpoints are not ready because pods haven't passed readiness probes, selectors don't match, or pods are in wrong namespace.

dead_ends.action: Remove readiness probes to make endpoints always ready
dead_ends.why_fails: Sends traffic to unready pods — causes application errors and timeouts
kube-proxy reads from endpoints API — if endpoints aren't ready, restarting kube-proxy won't help

workarounds.action: Verify selector labels match between Service and Pod: kubectl describe service <name>
workarounds.how: Compare service selector with pod labels: kubectl get pods --show-labels | grep <selector-value>

workarounds.action: Fix readiness probe configuration so pods can pass the health check
workarounds.how: kubectl describe pod <name> to check readiness probe failures, then fix the probe path/port/timeout

leads_to.condition: when ingress routes to a service with no ready endpoints

preceded_by.condition: when pods fail readiness probes and are removed from endpoints

frequently_confused_with.distinction: endpoint-not-ready means pods exist but haven't passed readiness, while service-has-no-endpoints means no pods match the selector at all
